results.title: The Nature of anthropology
results.creator_credit: Harry Ratner, Ira R. Abrams and Coast Community College District
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Faces of culture”.
Every man and woman has a story to tell which is finally the story of us all. The basic tenet of modern anthropology is that people are fundamentally alike but different and that all cultures are valid approaches to answering the question of who and what we are. Of the two major strands of anthropology - physical and cultural, this series is primarily concerned with cultural anthropology. Narrated by David Carradine.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Harry Ratner, Ira R. Abrams and Coast Community College District

results.title: Hitler's challenge
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “History 1917-1967”.
Describes German re-armament, changes in foreign policy, the failure of appeasement, and initial successes of the Blitzkrieg. Presented by Brian Redhead.

results.title: New China
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “History 1917-1967”.
Describes the main developments in China since 1949 - collectivization of land, the communes, the Great Leap Forward, plans for production, the Cultural Revolution and the Red Guard movement.

results.title: From war to revolution
results.creator_credit: John Radcliffe and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “History 1917-1967”.
Describes the development of the main opposing forces in China in the period of the civil war and disorder following the 1911 revolution, the war with Japan and the eventual establishment of the Communist regime in 1949.

results.title: The Cold war
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “History 1917-1967”.
Describes the origin and development of the hostility between the United States and USSR after 1945, the formation of the system of anti-communist alliances around the world and the respective spheres of influence. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: The Rise of Hitler
results.creator_credit: John Radcliffe, BBC-TV and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “History 1917-1967”
Describes the peace settlement after the 1914-18 War and its effects in Germany. Discusses the reasons for the rise of Hitler, the nature of his regime and the series of aggressive moves leading to war in 1939.

results.title: Lenin's revolution
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “History 1917-1967”.
Describes the background to the Russian revolution of 1917, Lenin’s intentions and policies and the consolidation of the Bolsheviks in power. Commentary by Brian Redhead. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Cosmos: a personal voyage
results.creator_credit: Gregory Andorfer, Rob McCain, Adrian Malone, BBC, Carl Sagan Productions, KCET (Television station : Los Angeles, Calif.) and Polytel
results.brief_description: Carl Sagan hosts this series of films which explore the mysteries of the universe and the origins of life.

constellations_other.name: A brief history of black holes on-screen
constellations_other.description: In 1916, Albert Einstein predicted black holes through his theory of general relativity. That mix of science and imagination can be seen in Marshmallow Laser Feast’s Distortions in Spacetime. These other works are fascinated by these cosmic giants and represent an evolution in computer graphics and VFX.

constellations_other.name: Future You
constellations_other.description: There are 47,000 possible variations of robot in Future You. There's probably not that many in all of screen culture, but these ones stand out.
